data.title: John Wayne

data.text:
John Wayne (1907 - 1979)

"You cannot kill John Wayne" is a quote that usually held true, but in a few of the many films in his long acting career, his character did not survive.

Film Deaths[]

Noah's Ark (1928) [Uncredited Extra/Stuntman]: Drowned in the great flood. (Wayne was just a stuntman and in IMDB it is mentioned he Andy Devine and Ward Bond we’re among the hundreds of extras but it is Unknown if he lived or not.)

Hangman’s House (1928) [Horse Race spectator/ Blindfolded Condeman]: Playing dual roles as a Spectator and a condeman, The condeman is shown in a flashback having a mask around his head and is hanged by the people.

The Deceiver (1931) [Reginald Thorpe's Corpse]: Stabbed to death (off-screen) by Sidney Bracey. (This part was actually played by Ian Keith during the "living" scenes; John only served as a stand-in when the body is discovered.)

Central Airport (1933) [Co-Pilot in Wreck]: Wayne is just a stunt in this film during the crash scene and is barely recognizable on Top of the airplane who is shown to fail to save a drunk passenger and go under the waves and die.

West of the Divide (1934) [Ted Hayden/Gat Ganns] Playing dual roles of both 'Ted Hayden' and 'Gat Ganns'. Gat Ganns dies after drinking from a poisoned water hole. Ted Hayden survives.

Reap the Wild Wind (1942) [Captain Jack Stuart]: Killed by a giant squid while deep-sea diving in an old shipwreck

The Fighting Seabees (Donovan's Army) (1944) [Wedge Donovan]: Shot in the chest by a Japanese soldier while driving his jeep towards an oil refinery tank. He succeeds in his intended mission when the jeep crashes into the tank and causes an explosion.

Wake of the Red Witch (1948) [Captain Ralls]: Drowns after being trapped beneath debris while attempting to recover sunken treasure.

Sands of Iwo Jima (1949) [Sgt. John M. Stryker]: Mount Suribachi is now taken over by US Marines and Wayne talks to his men who survived the battle before a Japanese in a spider opens fire and Wayne is shot to death. Forrest Tucker then reads a note that was in his pocket.

The Sea Chase (1955) [Captain Karl Ehrlich]: Drowned (off-screen) with Lana Turner when their lifeboat is sunk. (Although his IMDB trivia states death is undetermined, he and Lana may have made it to shore).

The Alamo (1960) [Col. Davy Crockett]: Stabbed in the chest with a lance by a Mexican soldier and blown up in the Alamo's arsenal when he sets off a massive explosion. (it's known that in real-life, Crockett's body was found whole and did not blow up in a gunpowder explosion).

The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance (1962) [Tom Doniphon]: Dies (off-screen) of natural causes. His coffin (but not body) is shown when James Stewart arrives at the funeral home, and the rest of the movie takes place in flashbacks set years earlier.

The Cowboys (1972) [Wil Andersen]: Shot in the chest and stomach by Bruce Dern (after first shooting him in the arm, leg and shoulder); he dies shortly after the teenage cowboys carry him back to their camp.

The Shootist (1976) [John Bernard Books]: Mortally wounded (on top of terminal cancer) in the saloon gunfight; he dies moments later at the end of the shoot-out with Richard Boone, Hugh O'Brian, and finally Charles G. Martin, with Ron Howard at his side after being shot in the back.

TV Deaths[]

None known

Gallery[]

Notable Connections[]

Father of Patrick Wayne, Ethan Wayne, and Aissa Wayne.

Grandfather of Brendan Wayne.
